Complex LaTeX visualizations (Tikz)

29 Jun 2012

You can create some very complex visualizations with LaTeX. Take a look at these:

[caption id="attachment_28871" align="aligncenter" width="322"] Circumscribed polygons and circles[/caption] Used matlab Source: texample.net

[caption id="attachment_28881" align="aligncenter" width="400"] Mosaic from Pompeii[/caption] Source: texample.net

[caption id="attachment_28891" align="aligncenter" width="400"] Plane Sections of the Cylinder - Dandelin Spheres[/caption] Source: texample.net

[caption id="attachment_28901" align="aligncenter" width="472"] Example: Dipolar magnetic field[/caption] Source: texample.net

[caption id="attachment_28921" align="aligncenter" width="408"] Gamma interaction[/caption] Source: texample.net

[caption id="attachment_28931" align="aligncenter" width="400"] A complete graph[/caption] Source: texample.net

[caption id="attachment_28961" align="aligncenter" width="497"] Pascal’s triangle and Sierpinski triangle[/caption] Source: texample.net

[caption id="attachment_28971" align="aligncenter" width="512"] Seismic focal mechanism in 3D view[/caption] Source: texample.net

[caption id="attachment_28981" align="aligncenter" width="492"] Membrane-like surface[/caption] Source: texample.net

[caption id="attachment_28991" align="aligncenter" width="494"] Computer science mindmap[/caption] Source: texample.net
